history.content:
From the 5th Year MS Website:

"3 Letters of Recommendation - Mixture of academic and industry letters is ideal. They should include details about your goals, accomplishments, technical and leadership skills, academic work, etc. We suggest to give your recommenders a few weeks to write your letters and upload them as PDFs through the link (provided from your online application). One of these letters MUST be from your MS research advisor and must explicitly state a commitment to advising, if admitted."

Source: EECS 5th Year Masters

I am applying for the EECS 5 year masters program and was wondering what the requirements were for the letters of recommendation. The application mentions that most programs need 3 letters of recommendation but I can't find anywhere that confirms whether it is 3 or just the 1 from a faculty who will advise you. Is is 3 letters or just 1?
history.subject: Letters of Recommendation for EECS 5 year Masters
